channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UFC's 42-Day Drought Ends With Two Stacked Cards—Here's When And How To Watch
item.description: UFC 324 kicks off 2026 on January 24 with Gaethje vs. Pimblett. UFC 325 follows January 31. Both stream on Paramount+ under the new deal.

item.title: No Electric Vehicles Buzz At 2026 CES—Bets Are On Autonomous Driving
item.description: CES continues to change and adapt, and that spells a solid future for companies with big investments in the technology.

item.title: WWE Raw's First 2026 Episode Has PLE-Level Stakes—Here's What You Need To Know
item.description: WWE Raw on Netflix January 5, 2026 features CM Punk vs. Bron Breakker for the World Title plus a Stranger Things crossover. Full card and how to watch...

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry says toppling of Venezuela’s Maduro will weaken Russia’s global standing as its oil ‘just became less important’
item.description: Russia’s oil exports are its “lifeline” and largely fund its war on Ukraine, says one economist.

item.title: Meet Greg Abel, the new boss of Berkshire Hathaway—Warren Buffett’s successor started out by selling empty soda bottles for 5 cents and now he’s a billionaire CEO
item.description: Warren Buffett’s successor Greg Abel first made money dispersing fliers and redeeming empty soda bottles. Now he's the billionaire CEO of Berkshire Ha...

item.title: Maduro’s capture puts Cuba’s Venezuelan oil-dependent economy at risk
item.description: The U.S. military captures Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, threatening Cuba's economy as the nation loses a key provider of oil supplies for communi...

item.title: Janet Yellen warns the $38 trillion national debt is testing a red line economists have feared for decades
item.description: Top economists fear the era of fiscal dominance is here, and we’ve abandoned the debt problem already.

item.title: As AI Moves Into Government, National Security Enters A New Era In 2026
item.description: From AI ministers to cyber risk at scale, 2026 marks a turning point as governments embed AI into systems that underpin trust and security.

item.title: Venezuela's billions in distressed debt: Who is in line to collect?
item.description: Venezuela defaulted in 2017 on government and PDVSA bonds, with accumulated interest swelling total liabilities far beyond original amounts.

item.title: Forget an MBA: Hasbro forces workers to sit through a Monopoly-style board game to see if they’re fit for the C-suite—and it’s a tactic approved by Reid Hoffman
item.description: Toy giant Hasbro is using a strategy game to train future CEOs—and leaders like Reid Hoffman and Elon Musk have long been fans of using games to learn...

item.title: Could Venezuela be another Iraq or Afghanistan? Lessons from American statecraft in force and legitimacy
item.description: Reemoving a leader — even a brutal and incompetent one — is not the same as advancing a legitimate political order.

item.title: Oil experts predict slight rise in gas prices as global tensions mount
item.description: Oil and gasoline prices could rise slightly due to Venezuelan export losses and geopolitical uncertainty, though pump prices remain at COVID-19 lows.

item.title: Widening K-shaped economy pattern across income groups
item.description: Bank of America data reveals a stark K-shaped economy as higher-income Americans spend 2.6% more while lower-income households manage just 0.6% growth...

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
